snippet: After a $457 million surplus, Michigan officials must sort out whether the worst is really over, whether it is safe to start spending again, or whether a rainy day fund may be the prudent course.
abstract: Michigan officials find the state has a $457 million surplus; they must sort out whether the worst is really over, whether it is safe to start spending again, or whether a rainy day fund may be the prudent course; majority of states have begun collecting tax revenues that are on par with or even above expectations, and face some measure of Michigan's situation.
lead_paragraph: After a $457 million surplus, Michigan officials must sort out whether the worst is really over, whether it is safe to start spending again, or whether a rainy day fund may be the prudent course.

headline.seo: Michigan Must Decide What to Do With an Unexpected Surplus
headline.main: Surplus Surprises Michigan, but Is It Safe to Spend Again?
headline.print_headline: Surplus Surprises Michigan, But Is It Safe to Spend Again?
